### eDiscovery – Identification, Preservation, and Collection (IPC) Software Procurement Solicitation

#### Solicitation Number: BPM016700/19859

Shared Services Canada (SSC) is seeking to procure a suite of software tools to facilitate and support federal departments and agencies in identifying responsive documents and preserving them in a forensically sound manner. This solicitation is for an Identification, Preservation, and Collection (IPC) software solution for the Department of Justice.

#### Key Submission Deadline:

*   Vendor registration deadline for demonstrations: March 1, 2024, at 2:00 PM ET
*   Solicitation closing date: March 26, 2024, at 2:00 PM ET

#### Procurement Process:

This procurement process involves a Challenge-Based Solicitation (CBS) approach, leveraging the Procurement Process 3.0 (PP3.0) framework. The process includes invitation to refine with industry, qualification stage (optional), solicitation among bidders, deployment of the solution, and provision of operation and maintenance services.

#### Trade Agreements:

This requirement is subject to the following trade agreements:

*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement
*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)

#### Submission Instructions:

All bidders must submit their bids through the Planned to Purchase (P2P) portal. Details of bid submission procedures are described in the Challenge-Based Solicitation document.

#### Security Requirement:

The security requirement associated with this procurement will be identified during the solicitation process.

#### Language:

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

#### Negotiation:

Shared Services Canada (SSC) retains the right to negotiate with bidders on any procurement.

#### Consultation:

Requests for information about this solicitation should be submitted to Michaela Criper at michaela.criper@ssc-spc.gc.ca. 

### Documents:

Please find the solicitation documents and Challenge-Based Solicitation document through the P2P portal.
